issue.title: [BUG]: Re-using previous partner email causes 500 error
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Current Behavior

Editing a partner email and then changing it back causes a 500 error

### Expected Behavior

Should work without error

### Steps To Reproduce

* In staging
* Log in as org_admin1@example.com
* Go into the Pawnee Parent Service (verified@example.com)
* Click `edit` for their profile
* Change their email to verifiedx@example.com
* Click `save` -- this works
* Edit again, change email to `verified@example.com` (back to what it started with)
* You get a 500 error!

### Environment (my info here is 99% joke, you can ignore and it is irrelevant)

```
awwaiid@vorm:~/human-essentials$ uname -a                                                                                                                                        
Linux vorm 6.2.0-26-generic #26-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Mon Jul 10 23:39:54 UTC 2023 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Lunar Lobster

awwaiid@vorm:~/human-essentials$ dpkg -l | rg firefox                                                                                                                            
ii  firefox                                     1:1snap1-0ubuntu3                                                          amd64        Transitional package - firefox -> firefox snap
```

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I've read the Code of Conduct and understand my responsibilities as a member of the Ruby for Good community

comment.body: Automatically unassigned after 7 days of inactivity.

comment.body: 😭  Yes, yes it was. Sorry for missing that! I have added the closing div tag back in and pushed it up.

pull_request.title: #3426 - Fix error handling on registration
pull_request.body: Resolves #3426 ### Description We want users to be directed back to the Account Request Form with direct feedback on what error(s) occurred, without having to click "I am an essentials bank" again. ### Type of change * Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) ### How Has This Been Tested? - RSpec: Added test via the account_requests_system spec - Locally tested in server to ensure render shows form and errors (see loom video below): - Go to `/account_requests/new` & select `I am an essentials bank` - Test 1: submit the form without entering anything or completing captcha - Test 2: complete the captcha only and submit the form - Test 3: enter valid information form data, but do not complete captcha ### Screenshots https://www.loom.com/share/cb83cce88b66484cb035950966382a1e

repo.name: human-essentials
repo.description: Human Essentials is an inventory management system for diaper, incontinence, and period-supply banks. It supports them in distributing to partners, tracking inventory, and reporting stats and analytics.

pull_request.title: Bump recaptcha from 5.15.0 to 5.16.0
pull_request.body:
Bumps [recaptcha](https://github.com/ambethia/recaptcha) from 5.15.0 to 5.16.0.
Changelog

Sourced from recaptcha's changelog.

5.16.0

  • Allow usage of options[:turbo] as well as options[:turbolinks] for recaptcha_v3
Commits
  • 124496f v5.16.0
  • 76f3715 Merge pull request #434 from hjhart/turbo-instead-of-turbolinks
  • 60c8e05 Update changelog
  • 294aeca Add changelog entry
  • 8373344 Allow the use of turbo to enable turbo functionality
  • b4e956a Merge pull request #432 from NARKOZ/NARKOZ-patch-1
  • 100b46b Improve documentation for action names per documentation
  • See full diff in compare view

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -100,7 +100,16 @@ def remove_role
   private
 
   def user_params
-    params.require(:user).permit(:name, :organization_id, :email, :password, :password_confirmation)
+    user_params = params.require(:user).permit(:name, :organization_id, :email, :password, :password_confirmation)
+    role_id = updated_role_id
+
+    user_params[:organization_role_join_attributes] = { role_id: role_id } if role_id
+
+    user_params
+  end
+
+  def updated_role_id
+    Role.find_by(resource_type: Role::TITLES[Role::ORG_USER], resource_id: params[:user][:organization_id], name: Role::ORG_USER)&.id
comment.body: Hi @dorner, thank you for the suggestions, can you please review the latest changes, thanks!

pull_request.title: 3828 fix admin users organization drop down
pull_request.body:
<!--Read comments, before committing pull request read checklist again

# Checklist:

- I have performed a self-review of my own code,
- I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas,
- I have made corresponding changes to the documentation,
- I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works,
- New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes ("bundle exec rake"),
- Title include "WIP" if work is in progress.

-->

Resolves #3828 

### Description
A user organization role was not being updated after selecting a different organization from the drop-down option on the edit page, which has been resolved in this PR.  
 
### Type of change

<!-- Please delete options that are not relevant. -->

* Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

### How Has This Been Tested?

* User edit spec updated to additionally test this fix.

pull_request.title: Bump redis from 5.0.7 to 5.0.8
pull_request.body:
Bumps [redis](https://github.com/redis/redis-rb) from 5.0.7 to 5.0.8.
Changelog

Sourced from redis's changelog.

5.0.8

  • Fix Redis#without_reconnect for sentinel clients. Fix #1212.
  • Add sentinel_username, sentinel_password for sentinel clients. Bump redis-client to >=0.17.0. See #1213
Commits
  • 2b183ad Release 5.0.8
  • 230a5c4 Merge pull request #1227 from supercaracal/add-sharded-pubsub-support
  • 54e6a7e Add sharded Pub/Sub support for cluster
  • ccdf15f Merge pull request #1226 from supercaracal/support-transaction-for-cluster-cl...
  • dda95f8 Support transactions for cluster client
  • c888c74 Merge pull request #1225 from afinzel/master
  • ad0f30b Update default timeout docs
  • 8e9183a Update sentinel auth with explicit kwargs (#1221)
  • 01de51a Merge pull request #1222 from supercaracal/fix-cluster
  • ea4d04a Fix redis-clustering gem to pass the test with latest dependencies
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=redis&package-manager=bundler&previous-version=5.0.7&new-version=5.0.8)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. repo.description: Human Essentials is an inventory management system for diaper, incontinence, and period-supply banks. It supports them in distributing to partners, tracking inventory, and reporting stats and analytics.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -100,7 +100,16 @@ def remove_role
   private
 
   def user_params
-    params.require(:user).permit(:name, :organization_id, :email, :password, :password_confirmation)
+    user_params = params.require(:user).permit(:name, :organization_id, :email, :password, :password_confirmation)
+    role_id = updated_role_id
+
+    user_params[:organization_role_join_attributes] = { role_id: role_id } if role_id
comment.body: If `role_id` is nil, I feel like we should be throwing an error rather than silently swallowing it.

pull_request.title: 3828 fix admin users organization drop down
pull_request.body:
<!--Read comments, before committing pull request read checklist again

# Checklist:

- I have performed a self-review of my own code,
- I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas,
- I have made corresponding changes to the documentation,
- I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works,
- New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes ("bundle exec rake"),
- Title include "WIP" if work is in progress.

-->

Resolves #3828 

### Description
A user organization role was not being updated after selecting a different organization from the drop-down option on the edit page, which has been resolved in this PR.  
 
### Type of change

<!-- Please delete options that are not relevant. -->

* Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

### How Has This Been Tested?

* User edit spec updated to additionally test this fix.

repo.name: human-essentials
repo.description: Human Essentials is an inventory management system for diaper, incontinence, and period-supply banks. It supports them in distributing to partners, tracking inventory, and reporting stats and analytics.

repo.name: human-essentials
repo.description: Human Essentials is an inventory management system for diaper, incontinence, and period-supply banks. It supports them in distributing to partners, tracking inventory, and reporting stats and analytics.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -100,7 +100,16 @@ def remove_role
   private
 
   def user_params
-    params.require(:user).permit(:name, :organization_id, :email, :password, :password_confirmation)
+    user_params = params.require(:user).permit(:name, :organization_id, :email, :password, :password_confirmation)
+    role_id = updated_role_id
+
+    user_params[:organization_role_join_attributes] = { role_id: role_id } if role_id
+
+    user_params
+  end
+
+  def updated_role_id
+    Role.find_by(resource_type: Role::TITLES[Role::ORG_USER], resource_id: params[:user][:organization_id], name: Role::ORG_USER)&.id
comment.body: Can this line be split up? It'd be a bit easier to read.

Breaking Changes

Fixed

Dependencies

pull_request.title: #3426 - Fix error handling on registration
pull_request.body: Resolves #3426 ### Description We want users to be directed back to the Account Request Form with direct feedback on what error(s) occurred, without having to click "I am an essentials bank" again. ### Type of change * Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) ### How Has This Been Tested? - RSpec: Added test via the account_requests_system spec - Locally tested in server to ensure render shows form and errors (see loom video below): - Go to `/account_requests/new` & select `I am an essentials bank` - Test 1: submit the form without entering anything or completing captcha - Test 2: complete the captcha only and submit the form - Test 3: enter valid information form data, but do not complete captcha ### Screenshots https://www.loom.com/share/cb83cce88b66484cb035950966382a1e

pull_request.title: #3426 - Fix error handling on registration
pull_request.body: Resolves #3426 ### Description We want users to be directed back to the Account Request Form with direct feedback on what error(s) occurred, without having to click "I am an essentials bank" again. ### Type of change * Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) ### How Has This Been Tested? - RSpec: Added test via the account_requests_system spec - Locally tested in server to ensure render shows form and errors (see loom video below): - Go to `/account_requests/new` & select `I am an essentials bank` - Test 1: submit the form without entering anything or completing captcha - Test 2: complete the captcha only and submit the form - Test 3: enter valid information form data, but do not complete captcha ### Screenshots https://www.loom.com/share/cb83cce88b66484cb035950966382a1e

pull_request.title: Bump recaptcha from 5.15.0 to 5.16.0
pull_request.body:
Bumps [recaptcha](https://github.com/ambethia/recaptcha) from 5.15.0 to 5.16.0.
Changelog

Sourced from recaptcha's changelog.

5.16.0

  • Allow usage of options[:turbo] as well as options[:turbolinks] for recaptcha_v3
Commits
  • 124496f v5.16.0
  • 76f3715 Merge pull request #434 from hjhart/turbo-instead-of-turbolinks
  • 60c8e05 Update changelog
  • 294aeca Add changelog entry
  • 8373344 Allow the use of turbo to enable turbo functionality
  • b4e956a Merge pull request #432 from NARKOZ/NARKOZ-patch-1
  • 100b46b Improve documentation for action names per documentation
  • See full diff in compare view
